theme.Question: Who said, 'The only way to do great work is to love what you do'?
theme.Explanation: Steve Jobs, co-founder of Apple Inc., emphasized the importance of passion and dedication in achieving exceptional outcomes.

theme.Question: Which famous writer coined the phrase, 'Success is not final; failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts'?
theme.Explanation: Winston Churchill, the renowned British Prime Minister, uttered these inspiring words during the darkest days of World War II, emphasizing resilience and fortitude in the face of adversity.

theme.Question: Who stated, 'It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop'?
theme.Explanation: Confucius, the ancient Chinese philosopher, emphasized the importance of perseverance and consistency in achieving goals, no matter the pace of progress.

theme.Question: Which famous author proclaimed, 'It is our choices that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities'?
theme.Explanation: J.K. Rowling, the celebrated author of the Harry Potter series, highlighted the significance of one's decisions in defining character and success.

theme.Question: Who declared, 'The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today'?
theme.Explanation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, the 32nd President of the United States, stressed the impact of overcoming doubts and fears on achieving future potential and success.
